courses.name: Bachelor of Technology (B.Tech)
courses.eligibility: 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics with minimum 45% marks (40% for reserved categories)
courses.admission_process: Through REAP (Rajasthan Engineering Admission Process) based on JEE Main score or 12th board percentage

courses.name: Master of Technology (M.Tech)
courses.eligibility: Bachelor's degree in relevant engineering discipline with minimum 55% marks
courses.admission_process: Through RMCAAP (Rajasthan MCA Admission Process) based on GATE score or state-level entrance test

courses.name: Diploma in Engineering
courses.admission_process: Through centralized admission process based on 10th marks or entrance test

courses.name: Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA)
courses.admission_process: Based on 12th marks or entrance test conducted by the institution

courses.name: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
courses.eligibility: Bachelor's degree with Mathematics at 10+2 level or graduate level with minimum 50% marks
courses.admission_process: Through RMCAAP based on state-level entrance test

courses.name: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
courses.eligibility: Bachelor's degree in any discipline with minimum 50% marks
courses.admission_process: Through CMAT/MAT/RMAT or institution-level entrance test followed by GD/PI

scholarships.name: Post-Matric Scholarship for SC/ST/OBC
scholarships.details: Covers tuition fees and maintenance allowance for students belonging to SC/ST/OBC categories with family income below the specified limit
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online through the Scholarship Portal of Rajasthan Government (scholarship.rajasthan.gov.in)

scholarships.name: Chief Minister's Higher Education Scholarship
scholarships.details: For meritorious students with at least 75% marks in qualifying examination. Provides Rs. 15,000 to Rs. 25,000 per annum

scholarships.name: Mukhyamantri Balika Protsahan Yojana
scholarships.details: Special scholarship for girl students pursuing technical education with Rs. 20,000 per annum

scholarships.name: Minority Scholarship
scholarships.details: For students belonging to notified minority communities with family income below Rs. 2.5 lakhs per annum
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply online through National Scholarship Portal (scholarships.gov.in)

scholarships.name: Sports Scholarship
scholarships.details: For students who have represented at state or national level sports competitions. Amount varies based on achievement level
scholarships.how_to_apply: Apply through Department of Sports, Govt. of Rajasthan

events.name: TechFest 2024
events.details: Annual technical festival featuring competitions, workshops, and exhibits

events.name: AI & Machine Learning Workshop
events.details: Hands-on workshop on AI and ML applications in industry

events.name: National Conference on Emerging Technologies
events.details: Research conference with paper presentations and keynote speeches

events.name: Cultural Extravaganza
events.details: Inter-college cultural competition with music, dance, and theatrical performances

grievances.contact: Anti-Ragging Committee of respective institution and Anti-Ragging Helpline: 1800-180-5522
grievances.procedure: Submit a written complaint to the Anti-Ragging Committee. For urgent matters, call the helpline. You can also file a complaint online at antiragging.in

grievances.contact: Women's Grievance Cell / Internal Complaints Committee of the institution
grievances.procedure: Submit a written complaint to the committee chairperson. Confidentiality will be maintained throughout the investigation process

grievances.contact: Accounts Department of the institution followed by DTE Fee Grievance Cell: 0291-2434271
grievances.procedure: First approach the institution's accounts department. If unresolved, file a complaint with DTE's fee grievance cell with all supporting documents

grievances.contact: Examination Controller of the institution and subsequently RTU Exam Grievance Cell: rtu.complaints@gmail.com
grievances.procedure: Submit application to the examination controller within 15 days of result declaration. For revaluation, a separate application with fee is required

grievances.contact: Head of Department, followed by Principal/Director of the institution
grievances.procedure: First discuss with the HOD. If unresolved, submit a written complaint to the Principal/Director. For serious issues, approach DTE grievance cell
Submit a written complaint to the Administrative Officer. For hostels, contact the Hostel Warden first
